newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SAL gets SES approval for rights issue.
newsitem.headline: SAL gets SES approval for rights issue.

text.p: Plastics manufacturer Showpla Asia Ltd (SAL) said on Friday it received approval from the Singapore Stock Exchange (SES) for its proposed renounceable rights issue of 80 million new ordinary shares.

The company said in a statement the SES had also approved its proposed public offering of 32 million new ordinary share in in connection with a proposed secondary listing on the Osaka Stock Exchange (OSE).
Showpla Asia is listed on the mainboard of the SES. The proposed rights issue, secondary listing and increase in authorised share capital are subject to shareholders' approval.
The secondary listing and public offering in Japan must also be approved by the OSE, the company said.
All shares have a par value of Singapore $0.25 cents and shares under the rights issue will be offered at US$0.19 cents.
It said the offer price in yen for each new share under the public offering in Japan will be fixed at a later date.

Proceeds from the rights issue and the Japan offering will be used to finance expansion of operations in Indonesia, to repay bank borrowings, to fuel growth of Showpla International Pte Ltd (SIPL) and for working capital.
SIPL is a 60 percent SAL joint venture which invests in the emerging markets.
It said some of its shareholders, Showa Plastics Co Ltd (SPC), Nomura/Jafco Investment (Asia) Ltd and Sumitomo Corp, have undertaken to subscribe for 54 million rights shares.
They hold together about 58.13 percent of the company's issued and paid-up capital.
